content:
Posted: December 7, 2013
												One of my alltime favorite games, Spiral Knights has been fun and addictive the moment I got it.I met some great friends in this game throughout years.What else is there to say about Spiral Knights other than pure greatness, but i think SK is slowly killing it self with the P2W(Pay to Win) element.What this game needs is more content to keep the current audience interested and to give the new players interesting story and gameplay.Pros:-A great MMORPG to start with-Even though the plot is hidden the game gives you some clue about what is going on which forms a rather interesting and somewhat dark story.-The overall friendly community.-It provides a tougher difficulty for more skilled players.-A mass variety of weapons,swords,equipment,armor... for you to choose.Cons:-Sometimes the levels feel the same and boring.-Minor bugs-Pay to Win which breaks the point of playing the game and gives a disadvantage to people that grind for resources.-Some times the game crashes for no aparent reason, not sure if its just my pc but it happends on my new one too.That was my review of Spiral Knights i hope you enjoy the game as much as i do.

content:
Posted: April 29, 2016
												Big piece of hell, annoying to play.I have to wonder if a large scale Javascript-coded game was ever functionnal, because about everything in this hump act unbelievably odd, making it rather unfun and tedious.The main problem is that the game lags/stutters a lot, and I mean A LOT.  Not a constant lag, but instead everything loads during gameplay (I could safely guess that's the case).  For example, if an enemy attacks, the game stutters to load the damage and/or attack graphics, same goes whenever a new enemy appears.  This gets very annoying during the middle of combat, where you need finesse, which is impossible due to the said stuttering.  It also does the same whenever you open up any menu, which is again very grating, and ruins the flow of the game.The worst cases are when stuff "teleports", so as myself, who by then didn't know I was going to appear right before enemies that also just appeared on the spot.  Attack range seems nonexistant, since I would avoid attacks, but get hit full blast, even with the shield up.Have to precise that I've been playing solely in singleplayer, so these problems aren't even from online lag, which I'd say would be even worse.  I highly doubt these issues would be a computer problem, I can't recall anything this bad, even Dark Souls's Blighttown would be proud of this game.To be a bit fair, even though it's free to play, it doesn't shove microtransactions in your freaking face à la Realm of the Mad God, and it still remained "fun" when it decided to work right.  Who would have guessed?  A free game that could've not sucked, as the developpers had an ounce of care, even the art style's fresh.I wish I could've also cared about some of the mechanics, such as the crafting and leveling, and I do like the idea of a planet made of many alien worlds' parts, but I just can't care enough if these problems keep happening.

All whale getting to the center of the planet to discover the unknown sorce of strange power.Overall i would say that this game is stunning.

content:
Posted: February 15, 2014
												It's a pretty simple game, save the world, be a knight, be adventurous. I always loved that sort of games and I still do. It's much múch better with friends because of the fun you can have and believe it or not: teamwork. Some monsters are hard to kill on your own and it's always handy to have a friend next to you :) Too bad somehow this game doesn't work for me on Steam anymore, but I still play it from the official Spiral Knights site. It ís free to play but you need 'Energy' to buy certain stuff. You can gain Energy by buying it with 'crowns (the currency)' but it does take a while. Still, if you play it for fun, it won't hurt.Overall a really fun game and really recommended if you want to hang out with your friends or just be adventurous. :)Score: 8/10

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 16, 2011
												After trying it out a few times, it didn't really grab me, but now having played it with friends it is a charming little dungeon romper with enough RPG elements to keep you coming back daily. For those who don't want to pay to play, you can only really play for 2 hours max a day (less if you die alot or want to do alot of crafting) as everything costs "energy". Free players get 100 to start with which you spend on using the lifts in the Clockworks to descend into your dungeons, at it recharges at 1 energy every 13 mins, so a total of 22 hours for a full recharge, however the micro transactions are quite cheap, but you could easily spend hundreds of euros/dollars on this game.Well worth playing if you want a bit of casual fun, with a rather addictive undercurrent.

There is a surprising amount of depth in the play, manifesting mostly in the way you handle your shield, but also coming in to play when modifying your loadout to deal with various different levels and bosses. More friendly than ever to try out with the removal of energy costs for playing, I'd highly recommend giving it a shot.

content:
Posted: November 13, 2016
												Hello all, and I hope you read this... (btw I didn't entirely play this game on steam, so that's why hours are kinda short)Like all the other negative reviews in this section, Spiral Knights is dying. It was an awesome game before, but it seems so empty now. It was an awesome game that I loved to sit down and play on, and I loved the atmosphere. Sadly, this game is a Pay 2 Win game that is rotting.I wish I could experience the game that I used to love, but sadly I cannot reccomend it now.All of those positive reviews are mostly newbies who just started, and they only list things like "10/10" or "Great game, check it out"Goodbye, Spiral Knights

content:
Posted: February 3, 2014
												A very interesting game. It's a unique idea and put together quite well. However I find it to be quite difficult in spots. Some missions take way too long to be able to complete. I don't feel as though the missions you do prepare you for some of the missions in future. You end up playing endlessly for a single item, then getting bored after doing the same thing over and over again.I recommend it simply due to the fact that it's quite fun and enjoyable when you play this game with friends. If you have help, this game can be fairly easy, but alone it gets boring and annoying.
